intro: Ruta hirsuta, commonly known as hairy rue, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, slightly toxic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that emit a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Ruta hirsuta is often used in traditional medicine and as a garden plant due to its ornamental value and historical significance.
